dsOverview.title: Canadian ISDM (formerly MEDS) Drifting Buoy Observations

summary.p: Canadian quality-controlled Integrated Science Data Management (ISDM, formerly MEDS) drifting (and some moored) buoy data, used as input for International Comprehensive Ocean-Atmosphere Data Set (ICOADS).
Data from drifters with deep drogues, collected by the Institut fur Meereskunde, at the University of Kiel from 1980 to 1996, are also archived in this dataset.
